intro: Meehania fargesii var. obtusata, commonly known as the broad-leaved meehania, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its tubular, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in late summer. The plant features lanceolate to ovate leaves that are usually hairy on the underside. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species in horticulture.
